p: In addition, the growth of HCV-RR in 5-Fluorouracil allowed us to select an HCV mutant resistant to 5-Fluorouracil that can replicate in vitro to moderate levels in the presence of concentrations as high as 3 Âµ/ml of 5-Fluorouracil and to parental levels in the absence of drug. The 5-Fluorouracil resistant virus accumulated multiple mutations distributed throughout the HCV genome.
